required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of Telehealth Mindfulness for Back Pain in the Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility and Acceptability of a Telehealth Mindfulness Intervention to Improve Outcomes of Patients With an Acute Exacerbation of Chronic Back Pain Presenting to the Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: While guideline-directed nonpharmacological strategies for chronic low back pain are well established, optimal chronic pain management for emergency department patients has yet to be defined. Mindfulness interventions can be used for management of chronic conditions, yet are understudied as a primary approach for patients with chronic pain discharged from the emergency department. Currently, there is limited evidence examining whether an individual telehealth mindfulness intervention is a feasible and acceptable for these patients. This study will develop, pilot, and evaluate the feasibility and effects of an 8-session (12-week) telehealth mindfulness intervention for patients with an acute exacerbation of chronic low back pain

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after discharge from emergency department
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of eligible patients enrolled in study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of enrolled participants who complete study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: Single item assessing satisfaction of overall results from telehealth mindfulness program.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Physical Function Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: 4-item physical function short form from the 29-item Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System scale. Total raw scores range from 4 to 20. A higher score indicates higher physical function, a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Pain Interference Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: 4-item pain interference short form from the 29-item Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System scale. Total raw scores range from 4 to 20. A lower score indicates lower pain interference, a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Pain Intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: Single item from the 29-item Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System scale assessing average pain intensity over the past 7 days rated on a 0 to 10 scale, with lower values indicates less pain, a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: Average number of pills per day (name and dose specified) and covered to morphine equivalent dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-reported return visits to the emergency department
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
secondary_outcome.description: Single item assessing return visits to emergency department.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
other_outcome.description: 15-item questionnaire assessing 5 facets of mindfulness (observing, describing, acting with awareness, non-judging of inner experience, and non-reactivity to inner experience). Facet scores range from 3 to 15. A higher score indicates higher level of mindfulness, a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
other_outcome.description: 13-item questionnaire assessing thoughts and feeling when in pain. Total scores range from 0 to 52. A lower score indicates lower pain catastrophizing, a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
other_outcome.description: 10-item questionnaire assessing confidence in ability to do certain things despite pain. Total scores range from 0 to 60. A higher score indicates higher pain self-efficacy, a better outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Depression Short Form
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
other_outcome.description: 4-item depression short form from the 29-item Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System scale. Total raw scores range from 4 to 20. A lower score indicates lower depression, a better outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System - Anxiety Short Form
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 3 months after discharge from the emergency department.
other_outcome.description: 4-item anxiety short form from the 29-item Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System scale. Total raw scores range from 4 to 20. A lower score indicates lower anxiety, a better outcome.

intervention.description: Enrolled participants will participate in an individual (one-on-one) Telehealth-delivered (online with audio and video) mindfulness intervention with a trained mindfulness therapist. The intervention is adapted from mindfulness-based cognitive therapy and includes eight sessions lasting 75 minutes each (except the first session which lasts 90 minutes) over a 3-month period.
